It's valuable yes, but some people make it everything about them. It's great to have a good college tag but it's not a must have. I personally know alumni from PES and similar colleges who have gone on to achieve significantly more than the average IITian. 

Tbf I've been working for a while now and one thing I've observed is that the best engineers I've interacted with both in and out of office aren't actually the T1 kids. It's always the T2/3/4 college kids who show the most passion and better skillset when it comes to engineering. Most IITians I've interacted with in the workforce are pretty lousy, disinterested and burnt out engineers who hardly put in the bare minimum to not get kicked out. Rarely you'll find them replicate the same work ethic they did during their JEE days. Most of them are comfortable with the paychecks they start with and don't do anything beyond what's asked, while it's these others who quickly rise up in their careers. 

Sure, the average IITian is miles ahead when it comes to solving PCM questions but that honestly doesn't translate to industry skills.
